title: How to Make Dhal Puri

steps.headline: Soak the cup of peas in water overnight.
Drain the water from peas after.
steps.description: Rinse the peas until the water inside runs clear.

steps.headline: Move the peas to a pot.
steps.description: Cover with water and boil on high heat.

steps.headline: Add salt.
steps.description: Cook until the peas have a bite to them.

steps.headline: Drain.
steps.description: Spread the peas out to allow them to air dry.

steps.headline: Add the 4 cloves of garlic and pepper to a bowl of a food processor.
Add the peas to the mix.
steps.description: Pulse again, until the result is very fine.

steps.headline: Move to a bowl and fluff the mixture with a fork.
Add the 2 teaspoons of cumin.
Add the 4 cups of flour to a large bowl.
Add the 4 teaspoons baking powder, 1 teaspoon sugar, and 1/2 teaspoon salt to the bowl.
Mix thoroughly.
Add 1 1/4 cups lukewarm water.
Knead the dough for 3 minutes.
Place this in a bowl.
Knead the dough for 2 minutes.
Cut into 10-12 pieces.
steps.description: Pat each individual piece into a disk.

steps.headline: Put the dough in one hand and form a cup.
Add the filling into the dough cup.
steps.description: Pinch the ends of the dough together to seal.

steps.headline: Place seam side down onto an oiled baking sheet.
Pat each ball with a little oil.
Repeat until all dough is stuffed.
Cover the dough with plastic wrap.
Heat a 12 inch cast iron skillet over medium heat.
Flour a surface and a rolling pin.
Flatten one of the balls with your hand.
steps.description: Roll the dough back and forth starting from the center. Turn into a 90-degree angle and keep until there's a round flat dough.

steps.headline: Move the dough to the skillet.
steps.description: Allow it to cook until it begins to puff up with bubbles.

steps.headline: Flip the dough.
Brush on a little oil.
Flip and oil the other side.
Cook for another 45 seconds.
Remove from heat.
steps.description: Put the dough into a basket lined with a tea towel.

steps.headline: Repeat until all the dough is cooked.
steps.description: Separate each one with a slice of wax paper to prevent sticking.

text: Making the Filling Soak the cup of peas in water overnight.  Drain the water from peas after. Rinse the peas until the water inside runs clear. Move the peas to a pot. Cover with water and boil on high heat. Add salt. Cook until the peas have a bite to them. Drain. Spread the peas out to allow them to air dry. Add the 4 cloves of garlic and pepper to a bowl of a food processor. Pulse. Add the peas to the mix. Pulse again, until the result is very fine. Move to a bowl and fluff the mixture with a fork.  Add the 2 teaspoons of cumin. Mix. Making the Dough Add the 4 cups of flour to a large bowl.  Add the 4 teaspoons baking powder, 1 teaspoon sugar, and 1/2 teaspoon salt to the bowl.  Mix thoroughly. Drizzle in the 1 tablespoon oil. Add 1 1/4 cups lukewarm water. Mix until the dough forms. Knead the dough for 3 minutes. Massage oil over the dough. Place this in a bowl. Let rest for 30 minutes. Assembling the Dough Knead the dough for 2 minutes.  Cut into 10-12 pieces. Pat each individual piece into a disk. Put the dough in one hand and form a cup.  Add the filling into the dough cup. Pinch the ends of the dough together to seal. Place seam side down onto an oiled baking sheet.  Pat each ball with a little oil.  Repeat until all dough is stuffed.  Cover the dough with plastic wrap. Let rest for 30 minutes. Cooking the Dough Heat a 12 inch cast iron skillet over medium heat.  Flour a surface and a rolling pin.  Flatten one of the balls with your hand. Roll the dough back and forth starting from the center. Turn into a 90-degree angle and keep until there's a round flat dough. Move the dough to the skillet. Allow it to cook until it begins to puff up with bubbles. Flip the dough.  Brush on a little oil. Allow to cook for 30 seconds. Flip and oil the other side.  Cook for another 45 seconds.  Remove from heat. Put the dough into a basket lined with a tea towel. Repeat until all the dough is cooked. Separate each one with a slice of wax paper to prevent sticking.
